This morning's (Fri. 7/31) message from our Superintendent:

Good Morning:
As I shared as a possibility in my communication yesterday, the Cuyahoga County Board of Health (CCBH) released a statement last night officially recommending school districts:

1) Begin the 2020-21 school year operating remotely due to the elevated health risk posed to students, staff and family members.
2) Discontinue extracurriculars such as sports, band, theater, choir and other activities during the remote learning period.

Today, I will be a part of a Superintendent’s meeting with representatives from the CCBH and watching their scheduled media briefing later this afternoon. We will also be discussing this topic with our athletic conference. I will provide an update on Sunday as to next steps our District will take due to these recommendations.

Sincerely,
Dr. Cameron M. Ryba
Superintendent

Mustang Spotlight - Mrs. Mikie Frey is a first grade teacher at Chapman Elementary. Mrs. Frey has been teaching in our District for four years. She started at Muraski Elementary in her first year and has been at Chapman for the past three years. Mrs. Frey earned her undergraduate degree from Slippery Rock University and her graduate degree from Youngstown State University.

“I love the curiosity and enthusiasm the students bring to school each day. As first graders they get so excited when they learn something new and I love being a part of their gaining confidence and independence,” says Mrs. Frey.

She adds, “ I love working with all of the staff at Chapman. It is a wonderful place to work. Everyone always works to do what's best for our students and is there to support, encourage, and celebrate others accomplishments. Chapman is really a family.”

Thank you Mrs. Frey for being part of a great team (and family) at Chapman! #WeAreStrongsville

Mustang Spotlight - Mrs. Tammy Ray is the secretary for our Food Services Department. Mrs. Ray has been in our District for twelve years, having spent over ten years working in the cafeteria at Strongsville High School. She earned her undergraduate degree from the University of Akron and has been a twenty-five year resident of Strongsville. Both of her sons attended Strongsville City Schools.

“It's very fulfilling to help our Food Services Department run smoothly. Whether it’s answering questions from parents, assisting the managers with deliveries and equipment, or helping with the financial aspects of operating the kitchens, I really look forward to coming to work each day,” says Mrs. Ray.…
